FuncDef:
The binding cipher-suite-customization command configures a name for the SSL cipher suite bound to an SSL policy.
The undo binding cipher-suite-customization command deletes the name configured for the SSL cipher suite bound to an SSL policy. The binding cipher-suite-customization command configures a name for the SSL cipher suite bound to an SSL policy. The undo binding cipher-suite-customization command deletes the name configured for the SSL cipher suite bound to an SSL policy. By default, no name is configured for the SSL cipher suite bound to an SSL policy.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an SSL cipher suite bound to an SSL policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo: During client and server authentication, an algorithm list is provided for the client and server to perform SSL algorithm negotiation. To configure a name for the SSL cipher suite bound to an SSL policy, run the binding cipher-suite-customization command. If no SSL cipher suite is bound to an SSL policy, all the available algorithms can be used by default.
